performances.venue: Evans Field House, Northern Illinois University Dekalb, Il
performances.description: outstanding black peter. i think it gets my #1 vote, check it out
How is this not here? Came to vote for it, because I was sure it had to be at the top, and it wasn't here at all. Wow. Acoustic and gut wrenching .

performances.venue: Cassell Coliseum - Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Blacksburg, VA
performances.description: Best of the best of the 77-78 versions. Jerry absolutely ripping licks and vocals ... "Run and See!!" series absolutely off-the-wall, then into S. Mag
The only Europe '72 one and a classic to boot.
Probably my favorite pre hiatus Black Peter...one of the best ever!!!

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: The Bear's Choice hypnotic version.
A standout version from a great show.

performances.venue: Louisiana State U Baton Rouge, LA
performances.description: Absolutely Criminal this hasn't been mentioned.  Jerry's on Fire, Run and See!!
A major hilight of a show chock full of 'em. Just wonderful emotion.
Jerry all in the sweet spot
love this version
An ultimate performance. Jerry's voice is in perfect shape. Powerful, chilling version that will make your hair stand on end. Shamefully overlooked.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: The final vocals, “Run and See” give me goose bumps and the Garcia solo is also very good.  I had this version from many years and lost it and always
Great Jam to end it

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York City, NY
performances.description: Low key and smooth - a real treat.  Show is known for its great DS>SS>11, but give this a listen.  Nice.
powerhouse performance from a top flight show.
Jerry is haunting on this one.  Beautiful

performances.venue: Horton Field House - Illinois State University Normal, IL
performances.description: Outstanding NFA>Black Peter.  One of the cooler late 70's versions.  Jerry voice is so tender!
Nice 'n mellow with a fine finishing flourish
Slow and intense.
Jerry shreds.
Peter's First Black Peter is The Dead's Best Black Peter
Moves more than usual, wedged in an epic second set medley. Might not be the best, but is damn good.
This is a very long reading of BP.  Of course gains intensity at end.  Special version.
Powerful vocals and a tight sound in front of what sounds like only 100 people.
mellow, smooth and all Jerry
Jerry is all over this one like stink on poop. This band is a never-ending source of awesome power

performances.venue: San Antonio Civic Auditorium San Antonio, TX
performances.description: Jam gets downright bluesy and Jerry belts out the final verse like his life depends on it. Released in 30 Days of Dead '13.
Black Peter tease->Truckin'->Black Peter. This was played apparently in memory of a well known head who was killed hitchhiking on his way to the show
Great recording, great Jerry soul, great Phil, makes me wanna cry with joy

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: SWEET!!!!!

performances.venue: Cape Cod Coliseum South Yarmouth, MA
performances.description: On a night when everyone is playing well they pull off this sweet version.
A cool little stand alone jam into Black Peter.
Mournful and Triumphant all at once. A mind-crushing outro by JG...best of the '70s IMO.
You will approve.
A little more love for the early ones? A strong and powerful version that never loses focus.  Beautiful.

performances.venue: Field House - Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute Troy, NY
performances.description: This is the Black Peter, Jerry rips the solos apart with no end in sight.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: This is on of the best Black Peters you will find from the 90's
So beautiful I had to stop it mid way through and start it again. Impassioned, clear sounding, great vocals and harmonies. (Phil!) Perfect.

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York, NY
performances.description: great vocals......

performances.venue: Felt Forum, Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Powerful version.  Show doesn't get the lvoe of the night before, but is every bit as deserving.

performances.venue: Boise Pavilion - Boise State University Boise, ID

performances.description: really sweet
Explosive and powerful a truly emotional Black Peter.
This is definitely one of the best, if not the best, since 1977. Jerry tore the mid song jam to shreds!

performances.venue: Niagara Falls Convention Center Niagara Falls, NY
performances.description: space>black peter.  slowly I turned.  step by step.  inch by inch.  NIAGARA FALLS!!!
After 10/29/77 this should be your go-to BP. Emotion oozes and Jer shreds the outro.
As fine a Black Peter as you'll find...just exactly perfect

performances.venue: Activity Center. Arizona State U Tempe, AZ
performances.description: This Black Peter aches with soul...
Jerry in a fanning frenzy
A slightly brisk and jaunty version that is smack-dab in the middle of a TOO. More bluesy rock than ponderous and Faulknerian (?).
So many Dec 69 versions on here already.  I  think this one is so clean and the distinctive rhythm sets this apart from the rest.
Jerry pulls out his peter on this one!

performances.venue: Glenns Falls Civic Center Glenns Falls, NY
performances.description: Great measured delivery, tremendous solo. Everything you would want from a great BP.
Not the 'ultimate' version, but a heartfelt late-era one with great playing and singing.
sweet emotional and oh so heady, please give this one a listen, he gets emotional fast. Wonderful

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: See HERE how Jerry completely NAILS the vocals then throws some dirty sauce on it - he's feeling it tonight!
Jerrys  voice is shot so he knocks over his mike stand and rips an amazingly sick solo.
Clangy, powerful version found here

performances.venue: Los Angeles Coliseum Los Angeles, CA

performances.description: As trippy a Black Peter as you'll ever hear

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: Heartfelt version

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Chilling version after the coma....especially the "See here how everything...." part. Flawless singing.
soulful
Acoustic, perfect
Mellow and cool. This one follows one of those Dancin's that'll knock your teeth out. This peter cools off the flames. Ghostly coolness.
Spring tour of 1990. Does not get a whole lot better than this. Absolutely amazing show in general
This one is pure stellar magic ripping.

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA

performances.description: This one is awesome, slow and melancholy, Gorgeous delivery Brent is perfect on this one.
Soulful Jerry solos and vocals. Peak year for this song.
Jerry and Keith generate so much soul here. Blue. Sad. Beautiful. The crowd response to the emotion just adds to the sweetness. ✌
Bow to King Peter! This ending sounds like TMNS duirng this era. Insane! Make sure to check out Betty Board(2nd set only)

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: A strong performance from a memorable show

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: The crowd erupts during this as Garcia is truly happy to be alive one more day. Chilling.
oh jerry this is nice
One of the first, and its strong and tight and powerful. Is there a bad show from Dec. '69?
They get inside of this one.  Some late spark from Keith and vibe is just right.
Once people hear this they will know the truth.
First Peter in awhile...the crowd had to be thrilled!

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: This is HUGE! Outro solo 1 of the best. Jerry is burning here!
Tribute to Belushi? First show since his passing, You can hear Jerry's guitar weeping. Mournful.

performances.venue: Montego Bay Freeport Zone Montego Bay, JM
performances.description: Tremendous the Hammond just adds so much power to the song and Brent plays it perfectly. Powerful Jerry delivery a true standout early in the AM in JM
another hot 1982 black peter this is a good one.
Really fine take with bluesy TC takes on keys and Jerry smoking the outro.
TC's last one. Always a sweet tune. Jerry sung this beautifully
heartfelt version!
Perfect Black Peter and fantastic jam that dissolves into a bit of space before Throwing Stones. How is this version not on here already?
Sweet bluesy outro jam. Spring ’78 was very good to poor Peter.
Roll on up, gonna roooooooooooooooooll back down
This one's purty good too.
not a great tour by any means, but this was a really nice black peter

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Maybe the best acoustic Black Peter ever...

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA

performances.description: Starts a bit rough, but the final solo and out chorus builds and builds into a blazing triumph.
Inside this not great show is a beautiful short acoustic set, including this perfect beauty. Totally overlooked.
Jerry in Jersey feeling close to death.
Really solid full band kicking on all cyliders Jerry very emotionally sung.
Jer's thoughtful and determined picking with nice tone. Bob's slide in check with nice harmonics. Jer throws hot sauce on short outro.
Hot take here - whole show is strong.
Very expressive vocals, tight excellent full band effort, a truly heady black peter

performances.venue: Cole Field House College Park, MD
performances.description: Drums are kinda swingy, gives the song something, Jerry makes you feel it

performances.venue: Buckeye Lake Music Center Hebron, OH
performances.description: Great version from one the best 1993 shows. Jerry's vocals are excellent and the outro jam smokes.
Whoah -- Go run and see!

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Still an infant, only two months old, this is a delicately sublime version. Available on the (un-numbered) Download Series from the Family Dog.
Slow, haunting, and dramatic. Comes slithering out of Space like a wafting plume of smoke.
A mellow early version.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
Des Moines Civic Center Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Great mellow version
Ethereal rendition, mellow, dark, loose, and cool vibes emanate from one of the best Black Peters of the year
Strong and powerful, like all the best versions of BP. Deep emotions on great pulse to this one.
Very nice rendering
Fantastic early version of Back Peter this to me is the torch bearer for the early versions of the song. The best up to this performance IMHO
POWERHOUSE delivery on the vocals here....This one is a BEAST if you like Peters!
Emotional Reading
Beautiful version with Jerry fanning like a madman at the end.
Wow this was in set one holy shit, great version
Jerry's voice sounds alright and he cuts up the ending.
Run and see. The mt. St. Helen show
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nfDme96o4GU
Good version, the whole show is great
You know the drill - passionate Jerry vocals, fanning, nice work from Bruce. 1991 is the shit.
Aching and poignant. Fairly standard for the mid 80s, and that’s a good thing….
Blazing!!!
So smooth and just about as flawless a version you will hear.
Stunningly good. Mysterious.  My favourite - for now!

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Electrifying! Jerry penetrating the ceiling with his solo.
Deep and dark with strong emotional jams. Lots of great Peters around this time.
There are some tempo fluctuations, but Jerry is hot this whole show.
Excellent
Take a look @ Poor Peter...Bruce Hornsby on keys
the day after the new orleans drug bust and phils amp blows so bobby and jerry play acoustics really really cool
Fanastic smooth version flows out of the other one. Truly a pleasure. Must hear.
Take A Look At Poor Peter
Real heavy and emotional a powerhouse version. Emotional and poignant a true classic version
Powerful, Jerry is on the delivery is emotional and crsip and the playing is angelic and powerful.
Beautiful, vocals are low in the mix not uncommon for Egypt, the playing is absolutely gorgeous it will swallow you whole. guitars sound gorgeous
Smoldering, wicked guitar solos, vocals are haunting and majestic. Emotionally powerful Jerry rings every word for what he can
Delivered with conviction...

performances.venue: Henry J Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Tremendous, mislabeled on the charlie miller board as the second NFA. truly hot piece of music right here. Sung with passion played spectacularly.
Beautiful acoustic version. The whole first set is one exquisite jewel after another.
Magical black peter on April Fool's day. 1991 has several good black peters this is arguably the best of them.
Passonate reading, smooth and dark.  really well sung. Relaxed pace just the right amount of backing keeps it stark and eerie.

performances.venue: Kansas City Municipal Auditorium Arena Kansas City, MO
performances.description: Brents organ really makes this one sound like Grateful Dead church and the way Jerry is signing really makes him sound like he's mourning someone.

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Jerry brings the soul to this, not a song I usually seek out but I enjoyed this.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: The recent talk of 5/7/78 BP got me on a kick and as much as I love everything about 5/7/78 this BP has something RPI is missing

performances.venue: New Haven Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: One of the more languid takes on this one. Although Jerry's voice is shot, it works. Notable for 2 runs through the solo, both of them stellar.
Jerry's vocals are great here.
Practically flawless early version played with focus and intensity.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: Jerry swithces it up a bit: ...look at poor Peter, he is "DROWNING" in pain...
this one comes out of a 'sotm' jam that really could have gone anywhere
Band was on a tear these three shows and although this night lacks a great recording those that exist have this deep cutting Garcia solo
Jerry plays the blues...so sweet!

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: A cool Greek version.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: An Alpine gem.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Nice
Typically it's that late 89-90 jerry voice that really gives us empathy for the protagonist, but this 1980 version takes the cake. Very bluesy
Slight up tempo but still real powerful with a tremendous ripping solo by Jerry Wonderful stuff.
Love this version. Nice slide playing through the main body of the song and some fine organ from Brent.
This is actually TC's last one
I believe all black peters from this pre-Workingmans era should be here. All are magic
TIFTOO>black Peter love it when they do the fast song then whoosh energy dropper
Finally picks up steam with the solo at the end.

performances.venue: Rutgers Athletic Center New Brunswick, NJ
performances.description: The first solo is sweet and beautiful. The outro is short, bluesy shredding.
Soulful laid back lazy beach version

performances.venue: Allan Kirby Field House Lafayette College - Easton, PA
performances.description: Why isn't this here? Cippolina chips in to make this a unique, and fully voiced Peter.
Knock out acoustic version from a great show.
excellent later era black peter. nice vocals and playing by jerry in an above average second set
The interplay between Jerry's vocals and Bruce's piano is brilliant.

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: A sleeper from an underrated show.
Jerry nails it. Beautifully sung and played.
I really do hate this song, but the improvisational jam at the end is mind-blowing.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Beautiful! The pain is there, but Jerry is lucid and feeling it. Flows nicely into Throwing Stones

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Dark with stanky Jerry riffs over Bobby whammy work. Right in my wheelhouse but might not be everyone’s cup of tea.
Kinda' surprised this hasn't been listed.  It's a worthy version.

performances.venue: Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Juicy keys and moments where we hear pin drops and sweet bombs.... Thanks Brent and Phil and....
Jerry’s first solo is killer!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Sounds more triumphant than haunting, but that's not a bad thing. Excellent soloing throughout, with the final minute being particularly great.
Heartfelt and Soulful
Middle of the road show at best, but this Black Peter portrays a certain beautiful somber joy that just clicks along with the very slow tempo
Raw and emotional a real nice Peter.
Just perfect acoustic version.
Sweet and soulfull. Brent and Jerry keep pushing each other without spoiling the mellowness of the tune. Woo hoo! Run and Sing!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Soulful.

performances.venue: Field House, U. of Cincinnati Cincinnati, OH
performances.description: Laid back acoustic
Crispy Kreme Black Peter! Super sweet...

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: This is a beautiful and emotional version, it's hard to hear over the crowd noise, but they where digging it!

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: This hit me perfectly. Well paced, lyrically nailed the poignancy, peak was driven. Nice late-era Peter
Jerrys vocals are in top form on this one.Just acoustic gutars here, jusr right.
Sweet acoustic '70 version. Always worth a vote
See here how everything lead up to this day
From prison planet song to actual prison song.  Foucault would be proud.
Slow and steady, emotive
Great version here,that builds nicely- Nice Garcia solo too.
Great version from Spring ‘81.  Brent’s organ adds some really nice texture
Perfectly sung, crisp solo, what more can you ask for?
Soulful

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Auditorium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Has a 70's-vibe in the midst of a solid, late-80's show. Fun stuff.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Love the tempo.  Not too fast and not too slow.. excellent phrasing in Jerry’s first solo
Great harmonies, Brent conjuring a sonic brew from the hammond B3. Epic yet grooving version to top off a stunningly underrated show.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Great harmonies. A real dirge to start, but ends triumphantly.
Hey, this is very well done!
Another great acoustic rendition

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: mournfully acrobatic delivery and searing tiger, love  it for days
Real nice solo on this one!
"Got his fingers on the dials and his mind in the bucket"
Fantastic "Peter" with a great outro where Jerry really lets 'er rip.

performances.venue: Onongada County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Good God people! This one is DRIPPING with emotion. If a SBD existed of this show it would be up top. GO RUN and See, now!
This one Rocks at the Rocks
Beautiful performance! Jer’s really singing with that ending solo.
Killer vocals. Great solo.
From the cold depths of 1982. Powerful, imaginative solo with surprising twists and turns. Listen to the matrix.

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Chilled and melodic - love this version
Such a beautiful clean tone on Jerry's Tiger here. I wonder how it sounded in the room, boy does it ever shine on tape.

performances.venue: Saenger Performing Arts Center New Orleans, LA
performances.description: Stunning organ parts that take the song to a different level. Feels like I'm going down a lazy river without a care in the world.

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Unusually high energy Black Peter, great playing and a strong finish
